content.question: Which of the following is the best description of a positive association between two variables?

choices.label: The values will create a line when graphed on a scatterplot.
The values will create a line with positive slope when graphed on a scatterplot.
As the value of one of the variables increases, the value of the other variable tends to decrease.
As the value of one of the variables increases, the value of the other variable tends to increase.
All values of both variables are positive.

content.answer: As the value of one of the variables increases, the value of the other variable tends to increase.

topic.text: 2.4: Representing the Relationship Between Two Quantitative Variables

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe data presented numerically or graphically.
